title: 2. The Electoral Regulations 2007 (S.I. No. 156 of 2007) are hereby
heading: (This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These regulations amend the list of photographic identifications that may be 
produced when a statutory declaration is being made by a person, who lives in 
the relevant constituency or local electoral area, assenting to the nomination of 
a candidate at an election to include a Garda National Immigration Bureau 
Card, a Temporary Residence Certificate and an Irish Residence Permit. The 
Regulations amend the list of specified documents which a voter may be 
required to produce at a polling station, to include a Garda National 
Immigration Bureau Card, a Temporary Residence Certificate and an Irish 
Residence Permit.
